description.p: You were born in a divine and holy way. This could mean that you were born on an important day or in a ritual, or that you are connected to the Gods and Goddesses in another kind of way. You can understand the workings of the Gods and Goddesses better than most. You have been appointed a sacred mission by the Gods and Goddesses and must survive until their deed is done. Being destined brings with it a lot of responsibilities. Most people who know you are destined expect heroic (and mostly impossible) things of you. Every destined faces the challenge of not knowing what they were destined to do. You never know whether you are doing what you are destined to do or failing and disappointing your deity.

ul.li: Languages: Hellic if you are chosen by Hel or Fenrir. Asgardian if you are chosen by any other deity
Equipment: A set of winter clothes, a scroll explaining you are destined to do something written by someone important to you, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

description.p: Most of the destined live on the road. They are travellers who seek quests in the name of their Gods and Goddesses. The destined try to do something that no one else could, not knowing what they must accomplish. Because of this, they tend to be obsessed with the notion of destiny, especially their own.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I believe every God and Goddess has their own way and that every way must be respected.
My path is the only true way. I tend to try and convert people to my belief.
I believe everything is a message about my journey, which means I can be nosey from time to time.
The only thing I know is that I must finish my journey, and I am determined to do so.
My God or Goddess may be with me, but its enemies are against me. I don’t let my guard down easily.
My faith is my shield. I have no fear, for I know that my deity will protect me at all cost.
I should live by my quest as I act as the shadow of my deity.
Nothing can stop me if I want something to be done.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Illumination: I will share all the knowledge and secrets I find along the way. (Good)
Path: I may be chained to my destiny, but even that can’t keep me from making my own path. (Chaotic)
Power: Once I have done my task and received my reward, every last creature will taste my power. (Evil)
Mission: Just as the Gods and Goddesses have made me, I have made my way. (Any)
Justice: I must not use my divine cause as an excuse to be unjust. (Lawful)
Unknown: If this journey is a question, I will have my answers. (Neutral)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I would die to complete my quest.
I would punish everyone and everything trying to keep me from my path.
I will do anything to protect my deity’s name.
Everything I do, I do for the followers of my deity.
I would do anything to protect my deity’s religious order.
I owe everything to my companions who helped me on my quest.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I trust my deity’s followers, gothis or alles, no question asked.
My way of doing things may be too violent for some.
I sometimes feel trapped by the quest bestowed upon me, and I secretly hate the Gods and Goddesses for it.
I expect the worst of anyone who does not follow my deity.
I feel the full weight of my quest on my shoulders, and it makes me paranoid.
I put my destiny before everything else, even before those that are important to me.

description.p: You have an aura around you blessed by the Gods and Goddesses. When you say you are following a path shown by the Asgardians or when people realize that you represent a God or Goddess, they can provide you and your allies with shelter. This shelter can be the house of a follower or sacred ground like a temple.
Also, people who follow the same God or Goddess as you will have a good first impression of you.

sheet.description: You have an aura around you blessed by the Gods and Goddesses. When you say you are following a path shown by the Asgardians or when people realize that you represent a God or Goddess, they can provide you and your allies with shelter. This shelter can be the house of a follower or sacred ground like a temple. Also, people who follow the same God or Goddess as you will have a good first impression of you.

description.p: You were born to (or adopted by) a merchant family and thus know how to handle money. You know the meaning of nobility and royalty and understand the subtleties of dealing with people from all walks of life. Not all Svillanders are fond of karls, and you may thus not be welcome everywhere. There may even be those who seek to strip you of your wealth.

You may work with your GM to determine the detailed circumstances of your past that may include what the family traded in, their level of prosperity, the relationships within the family, or your position within.

ul.li: Equipment: A set of traveler’s cloth, a pouch of 25 gp

description.p: Karls are the traders and merchants of Svilland. They earn a lot more money in comparison to the rest of Svilland. But unlike jarls, they don’t own any land or have any political power.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I am quite frugal and I always barter for the best price.
Bargaining is my hobby. I even bargain for items that I know I won’t buy.
Raiding, stealing or crafting. If the item is valuable, how I acquire it is not important.
I sell whatever I want to whomever I want; no matter how much others may be willing to pay.
None can appraise something as I do.
I try to learn special knowledge about people I bargain with, just to get lower prices.
Art has more value than the lives of those who cannot appreciate it.
Quality of product is the most important thing for me.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Commerce. Trading is the basis of our community. It is our duty to keep it up. (Lawful)
Fairness. I will see enough gold in Valhalla. I’d rather share my wealth in this life with the poor, with those in need, or with my friends. (Good)
Greed. I do not work for free. Everything comes at a price. (Evil)
Venture. Free trade means free life. I wander and trade because I want to. (Chaotic)
Trade. I only care about my work; nothing more, nothing less. I do not care what happens to items once I sell them, nor to people once they pay me. (Neutral)
Mission. I have a goal that I want to reach. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I’m quite close with my family, and my first duty is to them.
I had the best years of my life at home. I will return one day to help the folk there.
Money can buy protection. I am trying to protect my loved ones.
The customer is always right.
I will help anyone carrying my deity’s symbol. I have to help them to prepare for Ragnarok.
I keep the first gold piece I earned on my person at all times. That little piece is where all this began.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am always hungry for more.
I must become the wealthiest and most prestigious of them all. I am jealous of such people.
I must obtain the rarest pieces.
I have secrets about how I obtained my priceless treasures.
I can steal and even kill to get what I want.
I am brutally honest, even at the cost of others’ feelings.

description.p: You possess all the skills and tricks expected of a merchant. You can easily bargain for an item or understand a scam. You also have acquaintances from all over, owing to your many travels as a merchant. These people can help you find some specific items, places, or other people.

sheet.description: You possess all the skills and tricks expected of a merchant. You can easily bargain for an item or understand a scam. You also have acquaintances from all over, owing to your many travels as a merchant. These people can help you find some specific items, places, or other people.

description.p: You devoted your life to the ways and teachings of the Gods and Goddesses. In doing so, you have become an idol for some people. Reverends generally travel lands to enlighten people in the ways of the Gods and Goddesses and help those in need. You can be a traveller who spreads the teachings of the Allfather, or someone who settled down in a village to help the people there. Unlike some alles and gothis, reverends don’t have any connections to a temple nor any titles, and therefore do not receive orders from anyone.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Religion, Persuasion, or Intimidation
Languages: Asgurdian and another of your choice
Equipment: Texts of some of your teachings, a musical instrument of your choice, calligrapher’s supplies, and a belt pouch containing 20 gp

description.p: Reverends are generally unbiased about beliefs. Many of them start organizations or cults to spread the teachings of their deity. Some of them also rise in the ranks of society. Some reverends act as consultants and advisors to people in high places.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I love a mystery; each one opens up a path leading to new understanding.
I like to speak with hidden messages.
I read anything I can get my hands on, and love to discuss them with people.
The ends always justify the means.
All things in life are important; down to every last little detail.
Actions speak for themselves, words alone are never enough.
Gods and Goddesses see everything, therefore I never do something I might regret.
Gods and Goddesses work in mysterious ways and I follow their will.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Gratitude. Gods and goddesses have plans for everyone. We should all accept our lot without complaint. (Lawful)
Grace. Gold is nothing compared to the wealth granted by the sacred teachings of deities. Share them. (Good)
Tyrant. I carry the will of Gods and Goddesses. My word is the law and I can do no wrong. (Evil)
Will. Everything is the will of Gods and Goddesses. We must trust them. (Neutral)
Acceptance. Everyone’s faith is their own. People should be allowed to think however they want. (Chaotic)
Crusade. I will prove to everyone that my deity is the mightiest of all. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: The holy symbol of my deity is my most valuable treasure.
I always carry around little items related to the teachings of my deity.
I used to teach a child about my deity, I haven’t seen them for a while.
Everyone must revere my deity.
The holy sites dedicated to my deity must be preserved at all cost.
The relics of my deity must be explored and be put to use.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I easily trust the followers of my deity.
I hate those who worship the enemies of my deity.
I surrender my entire being and that of all others to my deity. No sacrifice is too great for my beliefs.
I fear losing my status in the eyes of people.
Abandoning the ways of my deity is my worst nightmare.
I do not like, nor do I tolerate, my deity being questioned.

description.p: You are a wise person that talks and shares thoughts. Generally, reverends are welcome in the homes of the royalty or the nobility, and most officials are willing to help you. In addition, people respect you and thus tend to listen to you talk about your teachings.

sheet.description: You are a wise person that talks and shares thoughts. Generally, reverends are welcome in the homes of the royalty or the nobility, and most officials are willing to help you. In addition, people respect you and thus tend to listen to you talk about your teachings.

description.p: At some point in your life, you were someone’s servant. You know what it is like to live in someone’s shadow, but this might be a good thing after all.

Thralls take care of a household’s daily errands and take care of the farm or animals if there are any. In return, they are awarded a decent place to sleep and some money to spend. They are not allowed to leave the village, but they can do whatever they want in their downtime as long as they get their job done.

Although thralls are considered servants, it is still considered cruel and dishonorable to give thralls demeaning or futile duties. Masters are expected to provide thralls with a good life. In fact, they can’t mistreat a thrall or are punished severely. If a thrall is beaten or killed by its master, the master gets stripped from all its titles. This informal rule ensures that all thralls are paid and treated well even if they work day and night.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of Hand and one of the following of your choice: History, Animal Handling, Medicine, or Nature

Tool Proficiencies: If you choose History or Animal Handling as a skill proficiency, you can choose one of any artisan’s tools. If you choose Medicine or Nature as a skill proficiency you gain proficiency with the herbalism kit.
Equipment: A set of common clothes, your release order from your master, and 4 gp

description.p: Thralls must work hard every day, just to earn their place in someone else’s land. For most, freedom means everything. Still, there are also thralls who want to serve a master. No matter what views thralls may have, they are the ones who work and fight for the gains of others.

set.name: Sleight of Hand, History/Animal Handling/Medicine/Nagure, Artisan Tools or Herbalism Kit

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I see my old master as an idol. I am ambitious to become a master like them.
I have spent so much time as a thrall that I have a bit of a hard time dealing with life as a free person.
Although I lived as a thrall, I try to approach the masters of thralls peacefully.
Although I lived as a thrall, I lived a life of prosperity. I don’t prefer this freedom.
I am optimistic about my future.
I am pessimistic about my future. I will probably become a thrall for someone else.
I am intolerant of thrall masters.
I always try to apply the lessons I learned from my old life in my new experiences.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Obedience. Life has plans for everyone. We must accept our lot without complaint(Lawful)
Freedom. I know that freedom is a gift. I must take advantage of the chance that I’ve been given. (Neutral)
Rebellion. I broke my chains once and for all. Nothing will chain me again. (Chaotic)
Liberation. I lived a life of pain and misery. Others should not. I try to help those in need. (Good)
Revenge. I lived a life of pain and misery. And now the tables have turned. (Evil)
Expediency. Life is chaos. One can live a life of prosperity by being a part of this chaos. (Chaotic)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I respect my former master for I have lived one of the best lives a thrall can. I would risk much to help them in times of need.
I have a secret that can lead my former master’s family to destruction.
I owe my life to my former master for saving me from death.
I’ve dedicated my life to other thralls.
I am in love with a member of my former master’s family.
I tend to dedicate my life to a goal.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I secretly stole things from my master and am now addicted to the rush of stealing.
I cannot resist the urge to help other thralls in need.
I hate all thralls who want to keep living as thralls.
I despise all authorities.
I tend to trust other thralls without question.
I secretly want to become a master.

description.p: History and 1 Artisan Tool proficienc
Animal Handling and 1 Artisan Tool proficienc
Medicine and Herbalism Kit proficienc
Nature and Herbalism Kit proficiency

As a thrall living in someone else’s house, you didn’t have your own life. But poor and aggrieved people know that they need to help each other to survive. You can ask poor people on the streets or in the wild for some favors like a place to sleep or something to eat.

sheet.description: As a thrall living in someone else’s house, you didn’t have your own life. But poor and aggrieved people know that they need to help each other to survive. You can ask poor people on the streets or in the wild for some favors like a place to sleep or something to eat.
